Back when I was 5 or 6, me and my siblings had sleep suits. These were fleecy all-in-one pyjamas, with zip up front. Lovely and snuggly for the cold months (We didn't have central heating till a few years later).
One night, my parents were entertaining some friends so I'd tried to get dressed for bed by myself without calling for my mum. Getting into the sleepsuit was no problem, but zipping it up obviously required more dexterity than I had. I enthusiastically yanked the zip up, stopping when it zipped straight up and gripped my penis with tiny, zippy teeth.
It was more shock at first, but then I realised how much it hurt. Stumbling downstairs, I walked into the living room where my parents were chatting with their friends, pointed at my, now probably quite red, trapped penis, and tearfully asked for help.

Whenever anyone makes a suggestion, comment "Well that doesn't make much sense to me, but then you are very small. Barroooooooooom".

Ravenous, with Guy Pearce and Robert Carlyle. Oh and David Arquette. Music by Damon Albarn of Blur too. Great film, not so much underrated as just not shown much. I guess it went straight to dvd on release. Also The Host, a Korean monster movie - great non hollywood action film.
Others: -the Korean vengeance trilogy (Sympathy for Lady Vengeance etc) -Immortel, a French sci-fi, comic book adaptation about Egyptian gods -Bubba Hotep, starring Bruce Campbell as Elvis Presley, again with an egyptian theme
DoA should definitely be on your watch list, if for some reason you've not seen it.
Outstanding :D
I feel left out as one of the few people who's never seen this before. I remain amused by it, despite finding out it's untrue.

You'd be surprised at how few people get this is if you read it out to them. Just adding the word "But" in the last sentence automatically makes some people assume it's a different time, so he must have run\used a bicycle, fallen over\been chased by a bull etc
Well done! +1 internets all round

A runner goes out for a jog around a local field every morning. The field is square, with corners A, B, C, D.
He runs from A-B, and it takes him 1min20, he runs from B-C, and it takes him 1min20, he runs from C-D, and it takes him 1min20, but when he runs from D-A, it takes him just 80 seconds. Why?
Amen, love that site. Comics that make you "hahaha, what's going to happen next! Ohhh :-(" But in a twisted funny way.

WRITING.TITLE: I caused offence with a recent joke about someones deceased son.
WRITING.TEXT:
In a crowed pub I asked my friend "What do you do if an epileptic has a fit in their bath?", following it up with the hugely, witty "You chuck your washing in".
A bloke from the adjacent table turned to me at that point and said that his son had died after having an epileptic fit in the bath. Shit, I thought, this'll teach me for telling offensive jokes. I apologised to him, saying I meant no offense. Chagrined, I asked him how his son died, did he hit his head on one of the taps perhaps?. "Nah", the bloke replied, "he choked on one of my socks"
